entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French pronuncier, from Latin pronuntiare, from pro- forth + nuntiare to report, from nuntius messenger pro-

def.dt: :to declare officially or ceremoniously the minister pronounced them husband and wife
:to declare authoritatively or as an opinion doctors pronounced him fit to resume duties
:to employ the organs of speech to produce pronounce these words
:to say correctly I can't pronounce his name
:to represent in printed characters the spoken counterpart of (an orthographic representation) both dictionaries pronounce clique the same
:recite speak the speech, I pray you, as I pronounced it to you Shakespeare
:to produce the components of spoken language
